intro: Quercus calliprinos var. palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine oak, is a small to medium-sized evergreen oak native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are leathery, elliptical, and have a distinctive silvery-white underside. It produces small, urn-shaped acorns that are an important food source for wildlife. This species is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats.
